identity.mission: Create a raw, industrial, and hyper-functional attendance system that feels like a physical tool, not a generic SaaS.

heading.usage: Page titles, Big metrics, Hero text. Use Black (900) for impact.

body.usage: General UI, labels, paragraphs. Technical and legible.

mono.usage: Wages, Hours, IDs, Tabular Data. CRITICAL for financial trust.

colors.description: Stark concrete greys punctuated by aggressive Safety Orange for action.

primary.usage: Primary Actions, 'Clock In' buttons, Active States.

background.usage: App background. Note: Not pure white.

layout_strategy.spacing: Generous but dense within data containers.

rules: Mono font for all numerical data

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-white hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-[2px_2px_0px_0px_rgba(0,0,0,1)] active:translate-y-[1px] active:shadow-none transition-all

inputs.style: Heavy bottom border or full box with sharp edges.

custom_modifications: Override Shadcn 'radius' variable to 0.2rem in CSS.
Use 'sonner' for toasts, styled as industrial tickets.

icons.style: Stroke width 1.5px or 2px. Sharp joins if possible.

textures.usage: Use login_background with a heavy dark overlay (bg-black/80) for the login screen. Use dashboard_overlay with opacity-5 mix-blend-multiply on the dashboard background.

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use 'Inter' for headings. Use 'Chivo'.
DO NOT use rounded corners > 4px. This is an industrial tool.
DO NOT use gradients. Use solid, high-contrast colors.
ALWAYS use 'JetBrains Mono' for wages, hours, and currency.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters.
instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Install fonts immediately in index.css. 2. Update tailwind.config.js with the 'Industrial Safety' palette. 3. Set global border radius to 2px. 4. Build the Dashboard using the 'Control Room' grid strategy. 5. Use the provided image URLs for the login page.
